ygData.subject: Re: Deciding which character to go with
ygData.msgSnippet: Judy, The barbarian warrior/shaman combo or the Human monk/cleric sounds like two best combos. You always want to have a healer around...you never know what
ygData.messageBody:
Judy,

The barbarian warrior/shaman combo or the Human monk/cleric sounds like two
best combos. You always want to have a healer around...you never know what
you can get yourself into when you go hunting =)

I leveled my dark elf magician to level 22 or so with my dark elf
necromancer friend. The combo worked out well too....but having a healer and
buffs are always better =)

Lanadana


----Original Message Follows----
From: Judy Tyrer <judy3t@...>
Reply-To: EQ_women@onelist.com
To: EQ_women@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_women] Deciding which character to go with
Date: Mon, 13 Sep 1999 15:46:40 -0700

From: Judy Tyrer <judy3t@...>

My partner and in game husband in four out of five of our character
pairs and boyfriend in one (the only chance I get to flirt with other
men *grin*) gets restless easily, as you can tell by the number of
character pairs we have. We have decided five is definitely enough and
want to choose which ones to take to the next level (10 to 20). It
takes little time to bring them up to 9 and longer through the teens.
But what we have noticed in the 20s is that it is a week or two per
level and with the amount of time invested we want to pick the
characters we like most to put that kind of time in.

Yes, we may take all of them to 20 and then decide, but right now we
need to decide for the next level, 10ish to 20ish. We roleplay and the
stories are important, but we can always change them, we can't change
character and class. We prefer to play together, we group when we meet
good people to group with, but there are times when we want to solo if
the other is not available. That is the major drawback to High Elf
wizard as if root fails I'm toast against even low blues.


Here are our couples:

High Elves:
Paladin 24
Wizard 22

Wood Elves:
Ranger 9
Druid 9

Humans:
Monk 10
Cleric 9

Dark Elves:
Necro 14
Mage 11

Barbarians:
Warrior 9
Shaman 9

We also roleplay and the Dark Elf story is the strangest and the human
the most boring. So, if people have their own favorites or see certain
advantages or disadvantages to the pairing, I'd love to hear opinions.
Who likes to play what and why is always a subject of great interest.
And as Wizard is the only role I have experience in past the newbie
stages, I'd love some advice on what makes good higher level play and
why.

Judy
